result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and returned.
Competency hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 10/11/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately upon release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not be in the State Street and Langdon area as indicated on attached map. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

*** IN CUSTODY ***

9:28 AM Defendant Cristian D Reyes in court.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court and parties discuss history and letters regarding competency evaluation not being complete due to defendant not cooperating. State requests cash bail be required. Statement by defendant. Court orders cash bail in the amount of $1,500 and adds Dane County Pretrial Services for gps monitoring. Court provides map to defendant for exclusion area. All other conditions remain the same. Competency Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be in the State Street and Langdon area as indicated on attached map. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

2:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cristian D Reyes in court, in custody via Zoom. Defendant declined assistance of SPD Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Colloquy with defendant regarding waiver of right to counsel. Discussion regarding potential competency evaluation. The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
